that's a government takeover of health care and the American people know it," Mike Pence said. Democrats countered that the law is already benefiting millions of Americans and should not be derailed. Because of the Affordable Care Act, Americans no longer have to live in fear that insurance companies will drop or cap their coverage if they get sick, or that they'll face double-digit premium increases with no accountability or recourse, Barack Obama said. of Evansville political science professor. If Mike Pence is to encounter any bumps at all, they could come early, as he shifts his focus from federal to state issues, Robert Dion said. In some cases, it can be an awkward transition, to go from being a lawmaker to an executive, and to go from the federal level to the state level. There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said. better riders and better friends." For the managing director of Global Action Sports, David Letterman Porra, the show, and the antics of Travis Pastrana , needs to be seen to be believed. Travis Pastrana is the greatest action sports star on the planet and to have him performing live at venues around New Zealand for the very first time is a massive coup for all of his fans there, said Porra.
